data.title: ‎‘Lightning Strikes Twice’ review by comrade
data.meta_description: extremely screwy gothic noir from king vidor in the full-throes of his ecstatic late-style, lounging camp mixed around with puritan metaphysics. mercedes mccambridge is in charming butch-mode and adds to the balmy desert atmosphere that's not too dissimilar from nic ray's johnny guitar -- the mystery of a woman's past, sifting through the detritus of a lost life, almost a total inversion of stahl's leave her to heaven, where here we start in the crime's aftermath and re-trace the gaps in its story, uncertain and off-balance until the very last reel. plotbrain'd viewers need not apply, as i'm not sure
data.text: extremely screwy gothic noir from king vidor in the full-throes of his ecstatic late-style, lounging camp mixed around with puritan metaphysics. mercedes mccambridge is in charming butch-mode and adds to the balmy desert atmosphere that's not too dissimilar from nic ray's johnny guitar -- the mystery of a woman's past, sifting through the detritus of a lost life, almost a total inversion of stahl's leave her to heaven, where here we start in the crime's aftermath and re-trace the gaps in its story, uncertain and off-balance until the very last reel. plotbrain'd viewers need not apply, as i'm not sure even vidor knew the exact logic of what's going on here. but the emotions, what emotions! paranoia, lust, a tell-tale heart in the midst of the american wasteland -- is it good? is it comprehensible? small questions in the face of Big Artistry.
